fr.insa.rennes.info.chemical.backend
Interface SubSolutionReactivesAccessor

All Known Implementing Classes:
SubSolution, SubSolutionElements
interface SubSolutionReactivesAccessor

This interface provides an access to reactives within an inner solution. This type of object should appear as an attribute of a reaction rule (see ReactionRule), and allows the user of the library to pick reactives in inner solutions. For more details, see the two implementations SubSolution and SubSolutionElements.

Author:
Andréolli Cédric, Boulanger Chloé, Cléro Olivier, Guellier Antoine, Guilloux Sébastien, Templé Arthur

Method Detail

getSolution

Solution getSolution()
Getter for the concerned inner solution. Returns the inner solution in which the elements are. Meant to be used by the user.

Returns:
the inner solution containing the selected reactives.

setSolution

void setSolution(Solution s)
Setter for the concerned solution. Meant to be used internally (not by the user), in order to set the reaction in which the reactives are found (if they were found).

Parameters:
s - The concerned solution

setTypeList

void setTypeList(java.util.List<java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.Object>> l)
Setter for the type list. This type list correspond to the desired reactives in the any inner solution, and it is set by the user in the constructor of its reaction rule class.
Example of parameter for this function that will request an integer, a string and an instance of the class "MyObject":
List l = new LinkedList(); l.add(Integer.class, String.class, MyObject.class);

Parameters:
l - the list of types, specified by the user.

getTypeList

java.util.List<java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.Object>> getTypeList()
Returns the type list, the list of the types of the desired reactives. This function is meant to be called internally (not by the user).

Returns:
the list of types

getElements

java.util.List<java.lang.Object> getElements()
Returns the set of elements/reactives - if the desired types were found in the inner solution. This method is meant to be called by the user in ReactionRule.computeResult() or ReactionRule.computeSelect().

Returns:
the set of elements/reactives corresponding to the types specified with setTypeList(List).

setElements

void setElements(java.util.List<java.lang.Object> l)
Sets the elements/reactives, when found. This method is used internally.

Parameters:
l - the list of elements/reactives found.
